data.title: Coffee Stop
data.text:
Nice setting with good coffee and of course donuts.
Only drawback was I must have visited on toddler day, it was too noisy to read the materials I wanted to read while having coffee.

data.title: Good donuts
data.text: All the donuts are square. Yummy,  but not outstanding. The peanut butter and jelly was pretty good. Lots of donuts are filled with jelly, etc...

data.title: Good Donuts
data.text: Despite the eye-catching name, the donuts were actually good.  They had a good range of different kinds with something for everyone.  Would stop again the next time we're in town.

data.title: Decent Donuts
data.text:
We stopped into this little bakery right before they were closing.  The (2) ladies in here were super sweet, and helpful when it came to choosing the donuts.  We all sat and split (2) donuts, just to taste them.

Square donuts are very flavorful, and decent in price.  The ladies were helpful in talking about Carmel, and what the city was like.

data.title: Dry donuts
data.text: The donuts were dry and not that unique.   I was very disappointed.  Have eaten much better donuts from Krispy Kreme.

data.title: Good service and yummy donuts
data.text: Square donuts is always my son's first choice when he gets a date with Mom or Dad.  They gave a great selection of fresh made donuts and good coffee.   The service is always nice and friendly.

data.title: Yum! Yum!
data.text: Friendly, accommodating staff. Held a small group meeting of high school students there. The taste testers all agree Yummy! Staff were very cordial and made it easy to take care of this group of about a dozen teenagers. Square Donuts was a great choice.

data.title: Interesting space with fantastic donuts!
data.text: Basic donut choices that are not only square, but outstanding in texture, taste and filling flavor.  The square donut seems trendy, but their story tells the reality of a long history of making square donuts.  A favorite for Saturday morning.

data.title: Always happy people!
data.text: The staff that run this shop are always welcoming and cheerful.  A wonderful place to visit for a great cup of coffee and some amazing maple glazed donuts.

data.title: Out of donuts 10:00 on Saturday!
data.text:
I hate this donut place. Out of donuts at 10:00 am on a Saturday. Geeze! 
Donuts are just ok too. The only reason my kids want these is because they are square.

data.title: AMAZING
data.text: I'm like a puppy when it comes to doughnuts. But, when I eat Square Donuts, it's even worse. They are so scrumptious, soft, and delicious that I have a hard time stopping with just one.

data.title: Tasty Donuts!
data.text: Very friendly people behind the counter, and we went when they had a special day.  My kids got to get a free painting lesson. They painted on a canvas...got a step-by-step lesson by an artist to learn to paint a Halloween scene on a canvas. It was a treat and some art.  We have visited a few times after.  Cute little place in Downtown Carmel to get a sweet treat.

data.title: Tasty Treat
data.text: I am a local and visit often for their cake donut offerings. Freshly made cake donuts with chocolate icing is my favorite! Great service, knowledgeable staff and friendly!

data.title: Yummy donuts, nice people
data.text: I will return!  The donuts were fresh and delicious.  I found the staff to be very nice as well.  Quick service!

data.title: Get there early!
data.text: The square donuts are the yeast donuts and they are terrific and pretty much like any yeast donut. They are a hit and usually sell out of the popular donuts by early afternoon.  Earlier if the high school is having a late start day. I like these better than Jacks, but not as well as Long's.

data.title: Outstanding local baker!
data.text: Our favorite weekend breakfast treat! Always fresh, great coffee and a convenient location The original Square donuts are soft, warm and melt in your mouth. The cake donuts are old school dense like they should be and available in the traditional styles along with some awesome seasonal flavors like pumpkin and lemon. The ladies are always friendly and patient while you choose from the 20 or so daily offerings.

data.title: Donuts are just OK
data.text:
Dont get this place... it is a coffee shop that sells donuts... The donuts are large in size, but taste like any other donut...

when we were there it was difficult to get a place to sit as people tend to hang out like it is a coffee shop... Reminded me of the coffee shop on the TV show Friends... young crowd, hanging out, checking their phones, and eating a donut... 

OMG do I sound old.... But, I just dont get it.

data.title: Always out of donuts!
data.text:
For some reason my children really like these donuts. My guess is it's because they are square. I'm so tired of going to this location in Carmel and they always being out of donuts or at least the flavors my kids like. Today is Wednesday at 10:00 in the morning and no donuts! It's late start at the high school which means that lots of high school students come and eat donuts before school. That's great but why not plan ahead? Make extra donuts those days. They schedule is published. I cannot tell you how many times this has happened. Not just on late start HS days. They are suppose to be open until 1:00pm but I'm not sure what they sell after 10:00 am in the morning. It's not donuts!
Thank goodness we have discovered Jack's donuts. They taste better and are bigger and less expensive anyway. We are going there from now on.

data.title: Best Bavarian Creme
data.text: I think Square Donuts has the best chocolate covered Bavarian Creme donuts of any shop in Carmel.  The glazed are tasty as well, and the coffee offerings are all good.  They may not carry all different varieties, but they're good at what they do.

data.title: One Donut will feel you up
data.text: Located on the corner of the Carmel Arts and Design District you can find Donuts! You will have to arrive early, they only have morning hours. The donuts come in a large variety of flavors, cherry, peach, apple, sprinkles pretty much any kind you love. They are huge! And current price is $10 for a dozen but worth it. Grab your coffee or buy a cup there and enjoy.
